channel.title: Computing on StatPREP Workshops 2019
channel.description: Recent content in Computing on StatPREP Workshops 2019

item.title: Introduction to RStudio.cloud
item.description: Background Setup your account on RStudio Cloud Running Little Apps IN DRAFT: Make a link to the RStudio webinar on Wednesday about cloud. Background The GAISE report’s Recommendation 5 is Use technology to explore concepts and analyze data. Elaborations on this recommendation are contained in Appendix D of the report, and include interactive applets, pp. 66-75 I think of these as a mouse-driven form of computation that requires absolutely no “coding” statistical software.

item.title: R Tutorials for instructors
item.description: StatPREP tutorials A StatPREP tutorial is an interactive document mainly intended to help instructors develop statistical, graphical, and general computing skills using R statements. This page provides links to instructor tutorials. Each link takes you to a web service that displays the document in your web browser. You don’t need to install any other software on your computer to use the lessons and tutorials. If you’re looking for materials for use in class or other student-oriented settings, follow these links to StatPREP activites or Little Apps

item.title: Stats for Data Science
item.description: Stats for Data Science is a forward-looking introductory-level textbook currently in draft form. The book is available on-line here. From the preface … Data science is an emerging computational discipline with roots sprouting in contemporary problems. Almost always these problems involve large amounts of data collected by automated systems and collated by bringing together diverse data from different sources. The goals for working with such data are varied: predicting the preferences of individual people for consumer products or news feeds; examining government or business or clinical medical records to answer questions such as the efficacy of a proposed program or intervention in public health; detecting and classifying rare events such as credit-card fraud; finding useful patterns in clouds of text or data that might help identify harmful interactions between medicines or extract meaning from thousands of documents.

item.title: Tutorials from Stats for Data Science
item.description: Stats for Data Science is a forward-looking introductory-level textbook currently in draft form. Each chapter has will have a short tutorial introducing the computing techniques relevant to that chapter. The tutorials from the initial chapters may be helpful to those starting out with R. Starting out with R Basics of the R language Functions and arguments Accessing data Data graphics
